alert.note: Alert for Coastal Volusia; Inland Volusia; Northern Brevard County; Orange; Osceola; Seminole; Southern Brevard County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 18 at 9:42PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Seminole, northern Brevard, southeastern Orange, southeastern Volusia and northeastern Osceola Counties through 1045 PM EDT... At 940 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Christmas, moving northeast at 30 mph. Additional strong storms from Sanford to northeast Osceola County will continue east-northeast through southern Volusia and Brevard counties though late evening. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Deltona, Sanford, Titusville, Oviedo and Winter Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Volusia; Inland Volusia; Northern Brevard County; Orange; Osceola; Seminole; Southern Brevard County
